pageContext.claim: “[Heads of corporations who have been to the White House 51 times] haven't cried since they were a baby. Some of them never cried at all, even when they were a baby -- and they start to cry when they walk into the Oval Office.”
pageContext.analysis: The White House shirked tradition, deciding not to release visitor logs. But this has all the hallmarks of a Trumpian tall tale. Politico kept an unofficial count of the executives with whom Trump interacted most through April 2018. At that time, Lockheed Martin’s CEO Marillyn Hewson led with five interactions. Plus, there have been no photos or corroborating reports of CEO’s tears at the sight of the Oval Office.
